derivation: apparently a primary verb (but probably akin to G142 (ἀρκέω) through the idea of raising a barrier);
kjv_def: be content, be enough, suffice, be sufficient
strongs_def: properly, to ward off, i.e. (by implication) to avail (figuratively, be satisfactory)
outline:
1. to be possessed of unfailing strength
    1. to be strong, to suffice, to be enough
      1. to defend, ward off
    2. to be satisfied, to be contented
